issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
The constraint can be subverted using e.g. call SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_IMPORT_TABLE, cf. the below script:

test.sql:
   connect 'jdbc:derby:memory:wombat;create=true';
   create table t_unique_nullable(i int, j int, constraint c_unique_n unique(i));
   call SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_IMPORT_TABLE ('APP', 'T_UNIQUE_NULLABLE', 'test.data', '|', '`', null, 1);
   select * from t_unique_nullable;
   create table t_unique(i int not null, j int, constraint c_unique unique(i));
   call SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_IMPORT_TABLE ('APP', 'T_UNIQUE', 'test.data', '|', '`', null, 1);

which fails in the second import, but not the first one, given this data file:

test.data
   1 | 1
   1 | 1
   2 | 2


run:
   ij version 10.11
   ij> connect 'jdbc:derby:memory:wombat;create=true';
   ij> autocommit off;
   ij> create table t_unique_nullable(i int, j int, constraint c_unique_n unique(i));
   0 rows inserted/updated/deleted
   ij> call SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_IMPORT_TABLE ('APP', 'T_UNIQUE_NULLABLE', 'test.data',
        				    '|', '`', null, 1);
   0 rows inserted/updated/deleted
   ij> select * from t_unique_nullable;
   I          |J          
   -----------------------
   1          |1          
   1          |1          
   2          |2          
   
   3 rows selected
   ij> create table t_unique(i int not null, j int, constraint c_unique unique(i));
   0 rows inserted/updated/deleted
   ij> call SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_IMPORT_TABLE ('APP', 'T_UNIQUE', 'test.data',
        				    '|', '`', null, 1);

fields.summary: Bulk insert of data with nullable UNIQUE constraint fails to detect duplicates

creator.name: dagw
creator.emailAddress: dag dot wanvik at oracle dot com

reporter.name: dagw
reporter.emailAddress: dag dot wanvik at oracle dot com

author.name: dagw
author.emailAddress: dag dot wanvik at oracle dot com

comments.body:
I found this issue by code browsing. I noted that in CreateIndexConstantAction, there is a specific SortObserver being used for the case of nullable unique (UniqueWithDuplicateNullsIndexSortObserver), whereas primary key/unique not nullable uses the observer UniqueIndexSortObserver.

However, in InsertResultSet#setUpAllSorts (used by bulk insert), there is a usage of UniqueIndexSortObserver of primary key/unique not nullable, not no provision for nullable unique, so it defaults to BasicSortObserver, which allows duplicates.

updateAuthor.name: dagw
updateAuthor.emailAddress: dag dot wanvik at oracle dot com

author.name: dagw
author.emailAddress: dag dot wanvik at oracle dot com

comments.body: Presumably the fix should be to add similar handling for the nullable unique case as exists in CreateIndexConstantAction.

updateAuthor.name: dagw
updateAuthor.emailAddress: dag dot wanvik at oracle dot com

author.name: dagw
author.emailAddress: dag dot wanvik at oracle dot com

comments.body: Adding a link here since this bug is fixed by a patch for DERBY-532.

updateAuthor.name: dagw
updateAuthor.emailAddress: dag dot wanvik at oracle dot com

comments.body: is a fix for this bug now checked into trunk?  How hard will it be to create a backport patch to get this fix into 10.10 without needing to add the DERBY-532 feature?

author.name: dagw
author.emailAddress: dag dot wanvik at oracle dot com

comments.body:
Yes Mike, it is checked in. I'll see if I can carve out this fix for inclusion in 10.10. Cf. the new test
testDerby6374 in ConstraintCharacteristicsTest.

updateAuthor.name: dagw
updateAuthor.emailAddress: dag dot wanvik at oracle dot com

comments.body: thanks Dag.   I can test and do backport if you provide patch, if that will help.

author.name: dagw
author.emailAddress: dag dot wanvik at oracle dot com

comments.body:
Uploading a patch {color:blue}derby-6374-backport-1{color} for backporting this fix to 10.10 (and possibly beyond).
It carves out the relevant piece from trunk https://svn.apache.org/r1545394, moving the test case to NullableUniqueConstraintTest.java. 

I have confirmed that the test fails without the patch to InputResultSet, and that is works with the patch.

Running regressions now on 10.10 branch. {color:red}Update: regressions passed.{color}

updateAuthor.name: dagw
updateAuthor.emailAddress: dag dot wanvik at oracle dot com

author.name: jira-bot
author.emailAddress: no-reply at urd dot zones dot apache dot org

comments.body:
Commit 1579737 from [~dagw] in branch 'code/branches/10.10'
[ https://svn.apache.org/r1579737 ]

DERBY-6374 Bulk insert of data with nullable UNIQUE constraint fails to detect duplicates

Backported to 10.10, had to do major surgery since the original fix
was part of a DERBY-532 patch.
